data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You always must go forward to return back to the starting point. The only instructions for taking steps left and right are the same. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around, the direction you are turned is changed. If you keep walking, you're still turning around. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person wishing to go back is given options for taking 6 steps, 4 steps and 10 steps. To go back to the starting point one takes 4 steps. To go around one has only 2 options, take 6 steps and take 4 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right. Take 1 step to make the 1st step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Thus, the answer is No.

Turn left 4 times. Take 7 steps. Turn around 6 times. Take 2 steps. Turn around 2 times. Take 5 steps. So, the answer is No.

Turn around you are already to the right. To return, you have to turn around and back, 7 steps which you would have taken if you were left in place. So, the answer is no.

If you stay right of the line of arrows going straight, and take 9 steps to return back to the starting point, the correct approach is to keep turning right. So, the answer is Yes.

Turning around the opposite direction you took the first steps causes you to be back at the starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you face forward and take one step left, you take 4 steps to the left. To take 6 steps forward is to take 6 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 3 steps and go back 1 step. Take 9 steps and go back 3 steps. Take 2 steps and go back 3 steps. Take 3 steps and go back 3 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

You always continue forward. When you take one step backwards, you always take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

One who always faces forward assumes that you will never face anywhere else. Walking this way, you will always face forward. Thinking this way, one will always approach with a "forward foot" and would not take 6 steps backward. Working this way, one would only need to take 5 steps left. If you work this way, you can always turn your back to facing forward. Working this way, one would only need to take 2 steps left. Therefore, the answer is Yes.

If a person always faces forward, one can have to take 6 steps left. You can take 6 steps left at a time if you have 3 steps left. Changing in the beginning from your starting point will take 6 steps left. Thus, the answer is No.

Each sequence has two sets of directions. If you take 3 steps right and then 3 steps left, you will go to the starting point. The second set of directions is facing up, which is the correct sequence. So, the answer is Yes.

Thus, the answer is no.

The beginning of the line moves in the direction of the left arrow. If you were to keep going in the same direction as the starting point, you would begin in another direction. Take 4 steps right. If you are walking forward, you should always take your first step right. If you are standing, you should always take your last step right.
